intro: Cymopterus melanotilingia, commonly known as the blackleaf evening-primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has slender, branching stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a distinctive dark green color with a slightly hairy texture. Cymopterus melanotilingia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas.
